column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Have a Fair Opinion
#Text=Everyone has an opinion on something ... and everyone is passionate about at least one cause or belief .
#Text=This article discusses how to develop your own opinion , and discuss it with others as well , without offending anyone holding a different belief .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Try to think about the other person 's feelings .
#Text=Empathize for a minute about why they have their opinion and why you have yours .
#Text=If they are thinking differently , agree to disagree , but do it in a kind way so that no one 's feelings are hurt and you can remain on good terms together .
#Text=Try to point out the good points in both your and their beliefs .
#Text=Even if you do n't completely agree , being a little open minded and understanding can always help to " put yourself in their shoes " for a while .
#Text=It is n't something you have to do for the rest of your life ; just for the time spent with this person .
#Text=Do n't get frustrated if they act rudely toward you , even after following these steps .
#Text=People will stick to their opinions , right or wrong .

#Text=The only possible way to try to get your point across is to actively listen to everything they have to say and understand why they have such beliefs , also the development of your own ideas and opinions on matters may be changed by the person you are arguing with .
#Text=Celebrate your differences .
#Text=Being happy about how diverse and different you are can lead to a much happier outlook on your different opinions .
#Text=So , do n't be ashamed to think differently just because you 're afraid of being ignored !
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do n't be harsh whilst disagreeing .
#Text=Being too defensive or acting too offended never works out well .

#Text=Stay very open minded when discussing an issue which you strongly believe in , understand the other persons opinions and who knows , maybe your own understanding and opinion on the matter may change as a consequence .
#Text=Most importantly , stay true to your own beliefs while celebrating your differences !
#Text=Still continue to have your beliefs , even if you are fine with the other person 's .
#Text=Be proud of what you stand for .
#Text=Have empathy .
#Text=Understanding that every person is different and making sure they know it 's alright that it 's that way can always help .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't be too aggressive .
#Text=Do n't get disgusted if they judge you on what you feel even after you express that you 're okay with the differences .
#Text=If they 're that shallow , then you probably do n't want them as a friend/partner/acquaintance in the first place .
#Text=Do n't feel ashamed of what you believe just because the other person may disagree with you .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Confidence
#Text=Empathy
#Text=Beliefs
#Text=A Good attitude
#Text=An open mind and heart
#Text=Patience
